com.preemptive.annotation.instrumentation

Annotation Type FlowControl


  • @Retention(value=CLASS)
@Target(value={TYPE,CONSTRUCTOR,METHOD})
public @interface FlowControl
    Defines a configurable flow controller for messages.

    This flow controller adapts the time that PreEmptive Analytics waits between sending messages to the server. It adapts the time it waits based on the rate of incoming messages using a low and high parameters.

    See Also:
    ApplicationStart, SendInterval

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      int dropAt
      The point at which messages will be dropped.
      int flushAt
      The point at which all messages will be sent.
      int high
      The point at which the interval will begin being decreased.
      int intervalStep
      The amount that the interval will be increased or decreased.
      int low
      The point at which the interval will begin being increased.
      int maxInterval
      The maximum value for the interval.

    • Element Detail

      • low

        public abstract int low
        The point at which the interval will begin being increased. If the number of messages waiting to be sent to the server falls below this value then the controller will begin increasing the interval until it reaches the maximum.
        Returns:
        the point at which the interval will begin being increased.
        Default:
        32

      • high

        public abstract int high
        The point at which the interval will begin being decreased. If the number of messages waiting to be sent to the server rises above this value then the controller will begin increasing the interval until it reaches the minimum.
        Returns:
        the point at which the interval will begin being decreased.
        Default:
        128

      • flushAt

        public abstract int flushAt
        The point at which all messages will be sent. If the number of messages waiting to be sent to the server rises above this value then the controller will attempt to send all messages to the server.
        Returns:
        the point at which all messages will be sent.
        Default:
        192

      • dropAt

        public abstract int dropAt
        The point at which messages will be dropped. If the number of messages waiting to be sent to the server rises above this value then the controller will drop messages to reduce the size to the point specified by high().
        Returns:
        the point at which messages will be dropped.
        Default:
        288

      • intervalStep

        public abstract int intervalStep
        The amount that the interval will be increased or decreased. This value is used when the number of messages drops below low() or rises above high().
        Returns:
        The amount that the interval will be increased or decreased in milliseconds.
        Default:
        50

      • maxInterval

        public abstract int maxInterval
        The maximum value for the interval.
        Returns:
        the maximum value for the interval in milliseconds.
        Default:
        30000
